NVIDIA (NVDA) Stock Analysis: Market Trends, AI Insights, and Trading Strategies for June 2025
NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) remains a cornerstone of the technology sector, particularly in the realms of artificial intelligence (AI), gaming, and data center solutions. As of June 16, 2025, NVDA continues to capture investor attention due to its pivotal role in the AI revolution and its robust financial performance. This article provides a comprehensive analysis of NVDA‚Äôs recent market movements, key news, correlations with other stocks, inverse ETF trading strategies, and the role of AI-driven tools from Tickeron in optimizing trading decisions. Leveraging data, statistics, and insights from Tickeron‚Äôs AI Trading Agents, this analysis offers a detailed perspective for traders and investors navigating NVDA‚Äôs dynamic market landscape.

This year, the stock gained+9.59%with an average daily volume of 274 million shares traded.The stock tracked a drawdown of-43.43%for this period.NVDA showed earnings on May 28, 2025. You can read more about the earnings reporthere.
NVDA‚Äôs Market Performance in 2025
NVDA has exhibited significant volatility in 2025, reflecting both its growth potential and market challenges. According to posts on X, NVDA experienced a 44% decline from a high of $153 to $86 over four months earlier in the year, yet analysts remain optimistic about its recovery. As of June 16, 2025, the stock is trading around $124, approaching a key resistance level, with some analysts projecting a potential rise to $170 or higher by year-end, driven by strong fundamentals and AI demand. NVIDIA‚Äôs revenue grew by 70% year-over-year, with free cash flow increasing by 125%, despite trading at its lowest price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio in six years, suggesting undervaluation. The stock‚Äôs average price target, based on 65 analysts, is $170, representing a 41% potential gain from its current price. Notably, 91% of analysts recommend a ‚ÄúBuy,‚Äù 9% suggest ‚ÄúHold,‚Äù and none advocate ‚ÄúSell‚Äù.
NVDA‚Äôs top holdings within major ETFs, such as the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY), account for approximately 6% of the fund‚Äôs weight, underscoring its influence in the broader market. Its beta of 1.7 indicates higher volatility compared to the S&P 500, appealing to traders seeking growth but requiring careful risk management.
Key Market-Moving News for NVDA as of June 16, 2025
Recent news highlights NVDA‚Äôs critical role in the AI and semiconductor sectors, with several developments shaping its market trajectory. On February 26, 2025, Bank of America reiterated a ‚ÄúBuy‚Äù rating with a $190 price target ahead of NVDA‚Äôs fiscal Q4 2025 earnings call, expecting a modest beat in sales guidance despite challenges from the Blackwell product transition and China restrictions. Evercore ISI also maintained an ‚ÄúOutperform‚Äù rating with a $190 target, noting NVDA‚Äôs 12% recovery from its February 3 low, though it lagged the S&P 500 by 7% due to concerns over AI demand shifts toward competitors like DeepSeek and ASICs.
Additionally, posts on X indicate strong retail sentiment, with NVDA clearing a key resistance at $115 and approaching $124, fueled by anticipation for its May 28, 2025, earnings report. Analysts expect robust earnings driven by AI and gaming sector growth, with some predicting a run-up toward $170 by year-end. These developments highlight NVDA‚Äôs resilience and its position as a leading AI innovator, though traders must remain vigilant of macroeconomic factors and competitive pressures.
Comparison with a Highly Correlated Stock: TSM
NVDA shares a high correlation with Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSM), a global leader in chip production, with a correlation coefficient of approximately 0.80 over the past year. Both companies are integral to the semiconductor and AI ecosystems, with NVDA designing cutting-edge GPUs and TSM manufacturing them. In 2025, TSM has shown similar volatility, with Tickeron‚Äôs AI analysis noting its pairing with the Direxion Daily Semiconductor Bear 3X Shares (SOXS) in trading strategies, yielding up to 104% annualized returns through Tickeron‚Äôs Double Agent Trading Bots. While NVDA‚Äôs P/E ratio stands at 28, TSM‚Äôs is slightly higher at 30, reflecting strong investor confidence in its manufacturing dominance. However, NVDA‚Äôs broader exposure to AI software and gaming gives it a slight edge in growth potential, though TSM‚Äôs critical role in chip supply chains ensures its stability.
Trading NVDA with Inverse ETFs
For traders seeking to hedge NVDA‚Äôs volatility or capitalize on potential declines, inverse ETFs like the AXS 1.25X NVDA Bear Daily ETF (NVDS) offer a strategic tool. NVDS is designed to deliver 1.25 times the inverse daily performance of NVDA, making it fully anti-correlated with the stock. Tickeron‚Äôs Double Agent Trading Bot combines long NVDA positions with hedged NVDS trades, achieving a 75% success rate by leveraging AI-driven pattern recognition and real-time risk management. This strategy allows traders to profit from NVDA‚Äôs bullish trends while mitigating downside risk during market corrections. For instance, in a declining market, the bot posted a +9.77% quarterly gain while the S&P 500 dropped 9.28%, demonstrating the efficacy of pairing NVDA with NVDS for balanced exposure. Traders must exercise caution, as inverse ETFs are best suited for short-term strategies due to their compounding effects and potential for significant losses in prolonged bullish markets.

Tickeron‚Äôs AI Trading Agents: Revolutionizing NVDA Strategies
Tickeron, under the leadership of CEO Sergey Savastiouk, Ph.D., has transformed trading through its Financial Learning Models (FLMs). These AI-driven models integrate machine learning with technical analysis to identify high-probability trade setups for stocks like NVDA. Tickeron‚Äôs AI Trading Bots, including the Double Agent and Single Agent, cater to traders of all levels. The NVDA Swing Trader Bot, for example, optimizes trades by factoring in AI and gaming sector trends, achieving up to 86.6% win rates in volatile markets. These bots provide real-time insights, seamless brokerage integration, and high-liquidity execution, reducing slippage and enhancing profitability. For NVDA, Tickeron‚Äôs tools have identified key patterns, such as bullish moving average crossovers and oversold conditions near the lower Bollinger Bands, enabling traders to capitalize on price movements with precision.

NVIDIA (NVDA) remains a powerhouse in the AI and semiconductor sectors, with strong fundamentals and significant growth potential as of June 16, 2025. Despite recent volatility, its 70% revenue growth, low P/E ratio, and analyst optimism signal a promising outlook. By leveraging Tickeron‚Äôs AI-powered tools, traders can navigate NVDA‚Äôs market dynamics with greater precision, utilizing strategies like the Double Agent Trading Bot to balance bullish and bearish positions with inverse ETFs like NVDS. Aroon Indicator for NVDA shows an upward move is likely
NVDA‚Äôs Aroon Indicator triggered a bullish signal on June 13, 2025. Tickeron‚Äôs A.I.dvisor detected that the AroonUp green line is above 70 while the AroonDown red line is below 30. Technical Analysis (Indicators)
Bullish Trend Analysis
The 10-day moving average for NVDA crossed bullishly above the 50-day moving average on May 08, 2025. This indicates that the trend has shifted higher and could be considered a buy signal. In 13 of 18 past instances when the 10-day crossed above the 50-day, the stock continued to move higher over the following month. The odds of a continued upward trend are 72%.
Following a +1.58% 3-day Advance, the price is estimated to grow further. Considering data from situations where NVDA advanced for three days, in 308 of 369 cases, the price rose further within the following month. The odds of a continued upward trend are 83%.
Bearish Trend Analysis
The 10-day RSI Indicator for NVDA moved out of overbought territory on June 13, 2025. This could be a bearish sign for the stock. Traders may want to consider selling the stock or buying put options. Tickeron‚Äôs A.I.dvisor looked at 41 similar instances where the indicator moved out of overbought territory. In 29 of the 41 cases, the stock moved lower in the following days. This puts the odds of a move lower at 71%.
The Stochastic Oscillator demonstrated that the ticker has stayed in the overbought zone for 7 days. The longer the ticker stays in the overbought zone, the sooner a price pull-back is expected.
The Moving Average Convergence Divergence Histogram (MACD) for NVDA turned negative on June 11, 2025. This could be a sign that the stock is set to turn lower in the coming weeks. Traders may want to sell the stock or buy put options. Tickeron‚Äôs A.I.dvisor looked at 49 similar instances when the indicator turned negative. In 32 of the 49 cases the stock turned lower in the days that followed. This puts the odds of success at 65%.
Following a 3-day decline, the stock is projected to fall further. Considering past instances where NVDA declined for three days, the price rose further in 50 of 62 cases within the following month. The odds of a continued downward trend are 66%.
NVDA broke above its upper Bollinger Band on June 03, 2025. This could be a sign that the stock is set to drop as the stock moves back below the upper band and toward the middle band. You may want to consider selling the stock or exploring put options.
Fundamental Analysis (Ratings)
The Tickeron SMR rating for this company is 12(best 1 ‚Äì 100 worst), indicating very strong sales and a profitable business model. The weighted SMR value is a proprietary formula developed by Tickeron and represents an overall profitability measure for a stock.
The Tickeron Profit vs. Risk Rating rating for this company is 13(best 1 ‚Äì 100 worst), indicating low risk on high returns. The average Profit vs. Risk Rating rating for the industry is 77, placing this stock better than average.

NVDA is expected to pay dividends on July 03, 2025

A dividend of $0.01 per share will be paid with a record date of July 03, 2025, and an ex-dividend date of June 11, 2025. The last dividend of $0.01 was paid on April 02.The ex-dividend date is usually set several business days before the record date. If a stock is purchased on its ex-dividend date or after, the next dividend payment will not be received. Instead, the dividends are repossessed by to the seller. If the stocks are purchased before the ex-dividend date, the buyer will receive the dividends.

(NASDAQ:AVGO), Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Ltd (NYSE:TSM), Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD), Texas Instruments (NASDAQ:TXN), Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT), QUALCOMM (NASDAQ:QCOM), Micron Technology (NASDAQ:MU), Lam Research Corp (NASDAQ:LRCX), Analog Devices (NASDAQ:ADI).
Industry description
The semiconductor industry manufacturers all chip-related products, including research and development. These chips are used in innumerable electronic devices, including computers, cell phones, smartphones, and GPSs. Intel Corporation, NVIDIA Corp., and Broadcomm are some of the prominent players in this industry. Semiconductor companies usually tend to do well during periods of healthy economic growth, thereby inducing further research and development in the industry ‚Äì which in turn augurs well for productivity and growth in the economy. In the near future, demand for semiconductor products (and possibly innovation within the segment) should only expand further, with the proliferation of 5G, autonomous vehicles, IoT, and various AI-driven electronics set to herald a new, advanced chapter in the technology-driven world as we know it. With burgeoning prospects comes great competition. In 2015, SIA estimated that U.S. semiconductor industry ranks as the second most competitive U.S. industry out of 2882 U.S. industries designated manufacturers by the U.S. Census Bureau.

Virtual Reality & Metaverse ‚Äì Nvidia
NVIDIA stretched his realm beyond just computing and AI, with the company set to play a major role in the future of the metaverse and virtual reality (VR). These rapidly growing areas offer big opportunities for NVIDIA and could influence its stock performance and overall market value over the long term.
Nvidia‚Äôs Metaverse
At the heart of NVIDIA‚Äôs metaverse strategy is the Omniverse platform, a real-time 3D design and simulation tool. This platform leverages NVIDIA‚Äôs strength in graphics processing and AI to build immersive virtual worlds. The Omniverse is being used in various fields, from architecture and engineering to entertainment, making NVIDIA a key player in developing the infrastructure for the metaverse.
Nvidia‚Äôs Virtual Reality
In the VR space, NVIDIA‚Äôs GPUs are critical for creating high-quality virtual experiences. As VR technology continues to improve, the need for more powerful graphics processors will likely increase, boosting sales of NVIDIA‚Äôs high-end GPUs. The RTX series, known for its real-time ray tracing, is particularly suited for creating lifelike VR environments.
What could we expect as an investor ?
The potential market for metaverse and VR technologies is huge. Some analysts predict the metaverse could be an $800 billion market by 2024 and could grow to $30 trillion by 2030. NVIDIA‚Äôs strong presence in this space could play a significant role in its future growth.
That said, the metaverse and VR industries are still in their early stages, and how they develop remains uncertain. Factors like user adoption, content creation, and technological hurdles could affect growth. NVIDIA also faces competition from other tech giants that are heavily investing in these areas.
Despite these challenges, NVIDIA‚Äôs technological leadership and strategic position in the metaverse and VR could provide significant growth in the long run. As these markets evolve, NVIDIA‚Äôs contributions to building metaverse infrastructure and enhancing VR capabilities may become key drivers of its stock performance.
For investors like us looking at NVIDIA‚Äôs long-term potential, it‚Äôs essential to keep an eye on developments in the metaverse and VR. While these sectors are filled with opportunity, their ever-changing nature also brings a degree of uncertainty. NVIDIA‚Äôs ability to seize these opportunities could shape its future market standing and stock value.
Conclusion

Nvidia Corporation (Nasdaq : NVDA) remains a top player in the tech industry with strong long-term growth potential. Our projections suggest NVDA‚Äôs stock could reach $169.34 in 2025, $846.14 by 2030, and $2,503.14 by 2035. Looking further ahead, it may rise to $4,072.35 by 2040 and $7,500.46 by 2050. These forecasts highlight Nvidia‚Äôs dominance and potential for substantial returns in the years to come. [...] These predictions are based on NVIDIA‚Äôs strong financial performance and leading role in the AI sector. Growth during this period is expected to come from ongoing innovation and the successful execution of strategic plans.
Investor confidence in NVIDIA has grown, with the company‚Äôs earnings per share (EPS) forecasts for fiscal 2025 increasing. This rise in EPS reflects steady profitability and operational efficiency, which are key factors in driving the stock‚Äôs performance. [...] Analysts anticipate that Nvidia stock prices may reach a value of$165‚Äì$185 per sharein 2025.
3) Is Nvidia a buy or sell right now ?
Nvidia is one of the largest player in major upcoming future technologies like metaverse & VR. So, our analyst are having a bullish outlook on Nvidia stock
4) What is the 12 month target for Nvidia stock prediction prices ?
The 12-month Nvidia stock price prediction could be around $170 which is an increase of ~48% from the current stock price of $114.06.

How MarketBeat Calculates Price Target and Consensus Rating
MarketBeat calculates consensus analyst ratings for stocks using the most recent rating from each Wall Street analyst that has rated a stock within the last twelve months. Each analyst's rating is normalized to a standardized rating score of 1 (sell), 2 (hold), 3 (buy) or 4 (strong buy). Analyst consensus ratings scores are calculated using the mean average of the number of normalized sell, hold, buy and strong buy ratings from Wall Street analysts. Each stock's consensus analyst rating is derived from its calculated consensus ratings score (0 to .5 = Strong Sell, .5 to 1 = Sell, 1 to 1.5 = Reduce, 1.5 to 2.5 = Hold, 2.5 to 3.0 = Moderate Buy, 3.0 to 3.5 = Buy, >3.5 = Strong Buy). MarketBeat's consensus price targets are a mean average of the most recent available price targets set by each analyst that has set a price target for the stock in the last twelve months. MarketBeat's consensus ratings and consensus price targets may differ from those calculated by other firms due to differences in methodology and available data.

Should I Buy NVIDIA Stock? NVDA Pros and Cons Explained
These pros and cons were generated based on recent news and financial data from MarketBeat in order to provide readers with the fastest and most accurate insights. They were last updated on Monday, June 23, 2025. Please send any questions or comments about these NVIDIA pros and cons to contact@marketbeat.com.
NVIDIA
Bull Case

Here are some ways that investors could benefit from investing in NVidia:

NVidia has received multiple upgrades from analysts, with price targets reaching as high as $210, indicating strong market confidence in its growth potential.
The current stock price is around $144, which may present a buying opportunity for investors looking to enter at a lower price point before potential gains.
Institutional investors own over 65% of NVidia's stock, suggesting strong institutional confidence and stability in the company's performance.
Nvidia's recent product innovations in graphics and compute solutions position it well in the growing AI and gaming markets, which are expected to drive future revenue growth.
The company has a solid financial foundation, with a low debt-to-equity ratio, indicating a strong balance sheet and reduced financial risk for investors.

NVIDIA
Bear Case

Investors should be bearish about investing in NVidia for these reasons:

Insider selling has been significant, with over 2.4 million shares sold recently, which may indicate a lack of confidence from those closest to the company.
Despite positive analyst ratings, one analyst has issued a sell rating, highlighting potential concerns about the stock's valuation or future performance.
The stock has experienced volatility, with a 1-year low of $86.62, which may deter risk-averse investors.
Market competition in the graphics and AI sectors is intensifying, which could impact NVidia's market share and profitability in the future.
While institutional ownership is high, it also means that any significant sell-off by these investors could lead to increased volatility in the stock price.

NVDA Forecast - Frequently Asked Questions
What is NVIDIA's forecast for 2025?
According to the research reports of 42 Wall Street equities research analysts, the average twelve-month stock price forecast for NVIDIA is $173.69, with a high forecast of $220.00 and a low forecast of $120.00.
Should I buy or sell NVIDIA stock right now?
42 Wall Street equities research analysts have issued "buy," "hold," and "sell" ratings for NVIDIA in the last year. There is currently 1 sell rating, 4 hold ratings, 34 buy ratings and 3 strong buy ratings for the stock. The consensus among Wall Street equities research analysts is that investors should "moderate buy" NVDA shares.
Does NVIDIA's stock price have much upside?
According to analysts, NVIDIA's stock has a predicted upside of 18.15% based on their 12-month stock forecasts.
Has NVIDIA been upgraded or downgraded by Wall Street analysts recently?
Over the previous 90 days, NVIDIA's stock had 3 upgrades and 3 downgrades by analysts.
What analysts cover NVIDIA?
NVIDIA has been rated by research analysts at Arete Research, Bank of America, Barclays, Benchmark, Cantor Fitzgerald, Citigroup, DA Davidson, Hsbc Global Res, HSBC, Mizuho, Morgan Stanley, Needham & Company LLC, Oppenheimer, Piper Sandler, Raymond James Financial, Rosenblatt Securities, Seaport Res Ptn, Summit Insights, TD Cowen, Truist Financial, UBS Group, and Wedbush in the past 90 days.
Do Wall Street analysts like NVIDIA more than its competitors?
Analysts like NVIDIA more than other "computer and technology" companies. The consensus rating score for NVIDIA is 2.93 while the average consensus rating score for "computer and technology" companies is 2.65. Learn more on how NVDA compares to other companies.

Save
Translate
Takeaways
Subscribe
Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang has started selling the chipmaker‚Äôs stock, his first transactions under a plan that allows him to offload up to $865 million worth by year‚Äôs end.
Huang disposed of 100,000 shares over a two-day period of June 20 and June 23 for $14.4 million, according to a filing Monday with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Huang‚Äôs sales are part of a new 10b5-1 plan adopted in March and disclosed last month in Nvidia‚Äôs quarterly report.

NVIDIA Corp video chip-by Antonio Bordunovi via iStock 
Despite recent market volatility and geopolitical concerns, Bernstein analysts maintain their bullish stance on Nvidia (NVDA), describing the opportunity as ‚Äúenormous‚Äù and arguing that the AI revolution is still in its early stages.
According to Bernstein, Nvidia is beginning a new product cycle with its groundbreaking Blackwell GPUs, which are experiencing unprecedented demand. The investment firm has a target price of $185 for NVDA stock, above the current price near $145.
More News from Barchart

Trump Is Giving Tesla‚Äôs Robotaxis a Leg Up Ahead of June 22. Should You Buy TSLA Stock Now?

Dear Nvidia Stock Fans, Mark Your Calendars for July 16

The Trump Family Is Betting Big on Mobile Phones. Should Apple Stock Investors Be Worried?

Our exclusive Barchart Brief newsletter is your FREE midday guide to what's moving stocks, sectors, and investor sentiment - delivered right when you need the info most. Subscribe today!

Nvidia‚Äôs Blackwell chips are reportedly sold out for the next year, with supply-demand imbalances expected to persist throughout 2025. This tight supply environment supports pricing power and is likely to translate into revenue growth for the coming quarters.

www.barchart.com 
The chip maker‚Äôs technological leadership has enabled it to control over 90% of the GPU market, supplying critical hardware to tech giants such as Microsoft (MSFT), Google (GOOGL), Meta (META), and Tesla (TSLA).
Nvidia Is Expanding in Several Growth Markets
Nvidia is at the forefront of addressing the global labor shortage crisis, with 50 million unfilled positions across the manufacturing and logistics sectors. Through a strategic partnership with Hexagon, Nvidia is enabling the development of AEON, an advanced humanoid robot designed for industrial applications.
AEON leverages Nvidia‚Äôs robotics ecosystem. AI supercomputers train foundation models, while the Omniverse platform provides simulation environments for testing and optimization.
Finally, robotic computers execute the models in real-world applications. This integrated approach accelerates development timelines, with AEON mastering core locomotion skills in just a few weeks.
The humanoid robot addresses critical industry needs, including reality capture, manipulation tasks, part inspection, and complex industrial operations.
And importantly for investors, Nvidia‚Äôs innovative work in humanoid robotics is just one small piece of the pie. It also offers investors exposure to data centers, high-performance computing, sovereign AI, autonomous vehicles, gaming, and more.
Is NVDA Stock Still Undervalued?
After a pullback in 2025, Nvidia‚Äôs valuation has reset to decade-long lows relative to projected earnings. Today, the tech stock trades a 33.6x forward earnings, below its 5-year average of 49.2x.
Story Continues
Bernstein maintains an ‚ÄúOutperform‚Äù rating, emphasizing that fears of the AI trade being ‚Äúover‚Äù are premature. With the global AI industry expected to grow at a 42% compound annual rate over the next decade and Nvidia maintaining its technological moat, Bernstein believes the growth story remains in its infancy.
Out of the 44 analysts covering NVDA stock, 37 recommend ‚ÄúStrong Buy,‚Äù three recommend ‚ÄúModerate Buy,‚Äù three recommend ‚ÄúHold,‚Äù and one recommends ‚ÄúStrong Sell.‚Äù The average target price for Nvidia stock is $174, indicating an upside potential of over 20%.

TRAINING: Nvidia Stock Report
June 24, 2025, 9:34 AM (EST)

Highlights

NVIDIA's stock showed strong resilience despite significant insider selling activity, with CEO Jensen Huang's $865 million share disposal plan and director Stevens' $88.36 million stock sale, suggesting investor confidence remains robust despite leadership's profit-taking.
The positive news sentiment score of 0.77 over the past week correlates with NVIDIA's impressive monthly return of 9.82%, significantly outperforming the S&P500's 3.92%, indicating news sentiment may be a leading indicator of performance.
China's unveiling of the "Meteor-1" chip to rival NVIDIA amid US sanctions represents a potential competitive threat, yet NVIDIA's stock maintained a 22.50% three-month return, suggesting the market views NVIDIA's technological edge as sustainable despite geopolitical challenges.
Federal Reserve Chairman Powell's comments about tariffs likely boosting inflation coincided with NVIDIA's slight weekly decline of -0.36%, pointing to market sensitivity around macroeconomic factors that could impact high-growth tech stocks.
NVIDIA's high risk profile (58.19% annualized standard deviation vs S&P500's 19.85%) is balanced by its strong performance metrics, with a 13.94% twelve-month return outpacing the S&P500's 11.29%, demonstrating that investors are being compensated for the elevated volatility.
The company's 26.7% quarterly earnings growth and consistent EPS outperformance (9.91% positive surprise in the latest quarter) align with the overwhelmingly positive analyst sentiment (58 buy/strong buy recommendations), validating the market's optimistic outlook despite the stock's high valuation.
NVIDIA's significant exposure to the Data Centre sector (58% relevance) positions it favorably amid growing AI infrastructure demand, though this also raises concerns about the environmental impact of AI's increasing energy consumption as highlighted in the WEF's "Artificial Intelligence's Energy Paradox" report.

News Analysis
Asset News
Recent news regarding NVIDIA (NVDA) includes significant insider trading activities, with CEO Jensen Huang initiating a share disposal plan worth $865 million. This development, reported by Seeking Alpha on June 24, 2025, may indicate a strategic move by the leadership, potentially affecting investor confidence and stock valuation. Additionally, director Stevens sold $88.36 million in NVDA stock, as noted by Investing.com on June 23, 2025. Such substantial insider sales could be perceived negatively by the market, possibly leading to short-term volatility.
In another significant development, China has unveiled a new chip, 'Meteor-1', aimed at rivaling NVIDIA amidst ongoing US sanctions. This was reported by Investing.com on June 24, 2025. The introduction of a competitive product from China could pose a challenge to NVIDIA's market share in the semiconductor industry, especially in regions affected by geopolitical tensions.
Furthermore, an article from Investor's Business Daily dated June 23, 2025, highlights how AI demand from giants like NVIDIA and Meta is driving growth in data centers. This underscores NVIDIA's pivotal role in the AI sector and its potential for sustained revenue growth.
News Sentiment Analysis
The sentiment analysis of NVIDIA (NVDA) news articles reveals a generally positive outlook. On June 23, 2025, the average sentiment score was 0.67 across 37 articles. Over the last week, from June 17 to June 24, 2025, the sentiment score improved to 0.77 from 285 articles, indicating a strong positive sentiment in the market.
This improved sentiment score correlates with NVIDIA's positive performance over the past month, where the stock delivered a return of 9.82%, significantly outperforming the S&P500 benchmark's 3.92%. The consistent positive sentiment despite news of insider selling suggests that investors remain confident in NVIDIA's long-term prospects and market position.
Over the past four weeks, from May 27 to June 24, 2025, the average sentiment score was recorded at 0.68 from a total of 1,717 articles. This consistent positive sentiment suggests that despite some insider trading concerns, the overall perception of NVIDIA remains favorable among investors and analysts, which appears to be reflected in the stock's strong three-month performance of 22.50% compared to the S&P500's 6.56%.
The scoring system used ranges from -1 for negative sentiment to +1 for positive sentiment. The high average scores over different time frames reflect a robust confidence in NVIDIA's market position and future prospects, which has translated into actual market outperformance during periods of positive sentiment.
| Sentiment Analysis |
| --- |
| Ticker | Name | Daily Score / No. Of Articles | Last 7 Days / No. Of Articles | Last 4 Weeks / No. Of Articles |
| NVDA | NVIDIA | 0.67 from 37 | 0.77 from 285 | 0.68 from 1,717 |
| Source: EOD Historical Data |
Market News
Recent market news highlights several macroeconomic factors that could impact NVIDIA's stock performance. According to MarketWatch on June 24, 2025, Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell indicated that tariffs are likely to increase inflation and affect economic activity. This could lead to broader market volatility, impacting technology stocks like NVIDIA. Notably, this news coincided with NVIDIA's slight weekly decline of -0.36%, suggesting potential sensitivity to macroeconomic concerns.
Additionally, Canada's inflation rate remained steady at 1.7% in May, as reported by CBC News. While this stability might suggest economic resilience, any changes in inflation trends could influence investor sentiment towards tech stocks sensitive to economic shifts. The stability in inflation rates may have contributed to NVIDIA's relative performance stability in recent trading.
The Bank of England's cautious approach to policy easing, as discussed by FXStreet, could also have implications for global financial markets and investor strategies concerning high-growth stocks like NVIDIA. This cautious monetary policy stance across major economies appears to be creating a balanced environment for NVIDIA, allowing its strong fundamentals to drive performance while macroeconomic factors remain relatively stable.
Earnings
NVIDIA's recent earnings report for the quarter ending April 27, 2025, showed an actual EPS of 0.81 against an estimate of 0.74, resulting in a positive surprise of 9.91%. This continues a trend of outperforming expectations, as seen in previous quarters where EPS consistently beat estimates.
The company's quarterly earnings growth year-over-year stands at 26.7%, reflecting strong operational performance and effective cost management. This impressive growth rate correlates with the positive news sentiment (0.68 over the past four weeks) and may be contributing to the stock's strong three-month performance of 22.50%.
Looking ahead, the EPS estimate for the next quarter is set at 1.00, with the report date scheduled for August 27, 2025. This projected increase in earnings suggests continued confidence in NVIDIA's growth trajectory, aligning with the overwhelmingly positive analyst recommendations (58 buy/strong buy ratings).
NVIDIA's impressive compound annual growth rates over one year (192.31%), three years (105.17%), and five years (82.06%) underscore its robust earnings momentum and potential for continued growth in the high-demand semiconductor sector. These exceptional growth rates help explain why investors remain bullish despite significant insider selling activities and geopolitical challenges like China's development of competing chips.

Analyst Recommendations
Analyst recommendations for NVIDIA remain overwhelmingly positive with a weighted average rating of 4.05 out of 5 as of June 1, 2025. The most popular rating among analysts is 'buy', supported by a target price forecast of 167.50 based on recent analyses.
A total of 12 analysts recommend a 'strong buy', while 46 suggest 'buy'. Only seven analysts advise holding the stock, with minimal recommendations for selling or strong selling (one and zero respectively), indicating broad confidence in NVIDIA's market position.
This consensus reflects optimism about NVIDIA's strategic initiatives and its ability to capitalize on growth opportunities in AI and data centers despite competitive pressures and macroeconomic uncertainties. The strong analyst sentiment aligns with the positive news sentiment score of 0.77 over the past week and correlates with NVIDIA's impressive performance metrics, including a 9.82% monthly return and 22.50% three-month return, both significantly outperforming the S&P500 benchmark.

Risk

Risk Analytics
NVIDIA is categorized as having a high risk level over the past year with an annualized standard deviation of 58.19%, significantly higher than the S&P500 benchmark's 19.85%. This indicates greater volatility and potential price swings in NVIDIA's stock, which correlates with the news about significant insider selling and competitive challenges from China's new chip development.
The expected volatility for NVIDIA is projected at 54.29%, compared to the benchmark's 17.41%, suggesting that investors should be prepared for substantial fluctuations in stock value. Despite these risks, NVIDIA's return over the past twelve months was 13.94%, outperforming the S&P500's return of 11.29%, indicating that investors are being compensated for the additional risk.
The Sharpe ratio for NVIDIA stands at 0.16, lower than the benchmark's 0.34, highlighting that while returns have been strong, they come with increased risk relative to the broader market. This risk profile should be considered in the context of the positive news sentiment (0.77 over the past week) and strong analyst recommendations (4.05 out of 5), suggesting that despite the volatility, market participants remain confident in NVIDIA's long-term prospects.

Performance
| Time Period (as of 06/24/2025) | NVIDIA Return | S&P500 Return |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 Day | 0.22% | 0.96% |
| 1 Week | -0.36% | -0.12% |
| 1 Month | 9.82% | 3.92% |
| 3 Months | 22.50% | 6.56% |
| Source: Daizy Analytics |
NVIDIA has shown strong performance over various time frames despite recent market volatility. Over the past day, NVDA returned 0.22%, underperforming the S&P500 benchmark which gained 0.96%. However, over the past month, NVIDIA delivered an impressive return of 9.82%, significantly outstripping the benchmark's return of 3.92%. This monthly outperformance correlates strongly with the improved news sentiment score of 0.77 over the past week, suggesting positive news coverage may be driving investor confidence.
Over three months, NVIDIA's performance was particularly robust with a return of 22.50%, compared to the S&P500's gain of only 6.56%. This highlights NVIDIA's ability to capitalize on market trends and its strong positioning within the tech sector. The three-month performance period coincides with continued positive news about AI demand growth and NVIDIA's central role in powering AI infrastructure, as referenced in recent articles.
Despite a slight weekly decline of -0.36% compared to the benchmark's -0.12%, NVIDIA's overall performance reflects its resilience and growth potential amidst challenging market conditions. This minor weekly setback occurred during the same period as news about Federal Reserve Chairman Powell's comments on tariffs potentially increasing inflation, suggesting some sensitivity to macroeconomic factors. Nevertheless, the broader performance metrics indicate that positive sentiment and strong fundamentals continue to drive NVIDIA's outperformance over longer time horizons.

Influence Map
NVIDIA's operations are significantly influenced by its involvement in several key industries according to CityFalcon data sourced from recent news articles and company profiles. The Data Centre sector holds the highest relevance at 58%, underscoring NVIDIA's pivotal role in powering modern computing infrastructure with its GPUs and AI technologies.
The Integrated Circuits sector follows closely with a relevance of 40%. This area is crucial for NVIDIA as it continues to innovate in chip design and manufacturing processes to maintain its competitive edge against emerging rivals like China's Meteor-1 chip, which was recently reported in the news.
Additional exposure includes Electronic Components at 34% and Cloud Computing at 30%, reflecting NVIDIA's strategic focus on expanding its ecosystem through partnerships and technological advancements in these rapidly growing sectors. This diversified influence map aligns with recent news highlighting NVIDIA's central role in powering AI data centers, as mentioned in the Investor's Business Daily article, and explains why the company has maintained strong performance metrics despite challenges in specific areas.

Sustainability Analysis
NVIDIA demonstrates strong sustainability credentials with carbon emissions measured at only 3.2 metric tonnes per $1 million sales, significantly lower than both the semiconductor sector average of 107.3 metric tonnes and the S&P500 benchmark of 100 metric tonnes per $1 million sales.
However, as highlighted in the World Economic Forum's January 2025 white paper "Artificial Intelligence's Energy Paradox: Balancing Challenges and Opportunities," NVIDIA's growing role in the AI ecosystem presents significant environmental challenges. The report notes that "AI-related electricity consumption is expected to grow by as much as 50% annually from 2023 to 2030," with data centers being a primary driver of this growth. As the leading provider of AI chips and infrastructure, NVIDIA's products are at the center of this energy consumption challenge.
The WEF report emphasizes that "model deployment is AI's most energy-intensive stage (accounting for approximately 60%)" and that "data centre consumption includes both AI and non-AI elements. AI processing, particularly for generative AI, is more energy-intensive due to large model complexity, longer training durations and substantial data processing." Given NVIDIA's 58% relevance to the Data Centre sector, the company faces both responsibility and opportunity in addressing these sustainability challenges.
While NVIDIA's own ESG scores reflect leadership within the Information Technology sector with an overall ESG score of 10 (surpassing both sector and benchmark averages), the company's future sustainability profile will increasingly be tied to how it addresses the energy paradox identified in the WEF report. The report suggests several strategies that companies like NVIDIA could implement, including "energy-efficient hardware (e.g. chips) and models" that "reduce electricity consumption throughout the AI life cycle" - an area where NVIDIA has both expertise and influence.
As the WEF report concludes, "AI's rapid expansion and increased electricity demand will likely present energy system challenges. However, the technology also brings opportunities and benefits, including enhanced renewable infrastructure, grid stability, and demand management." NVIDIA's sustainability journey will likely involve balancing these challenges and opportunities as AI adoption continues to accelerate.

NVIDIA (NVDA) Stock Analysis: Market Trends, AI Insights, and Trading Strategies for June 2025
NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) remains a cornerstone of the technology sector, particularly in the realms of artificial intelligence (AI), gaming, and data center solutions. As of June 16, 2025, NVDA continues to capture investor attention due to its pivotal role in the AI revolution and its robust financial performance. This article provides a comprehensive analysis of NVDA‚Äôs recent market movements, key news, correlations with other stocks, inverse ETF trading strategies, and the role of AI-driven tools from Tickeron in optimizing trading decisions. Leveraging data, statistics, and insights from Tickeron‚Äôs AI Trading Agents, this analysis offers a detailed perspective for traders and investors navigating NVDA‚Äôs dynamic market landscape.

This year, the stock gained+9.59%with an average daily volume of 274 million shares traded.The stock tracked a drawdown of-43.43%for this period.NVDA showed earnings on May 28, 2025. You can read more about the earnings reporthere.
NVDA‚Äôs Market Performance in 2025
NVDA has exhibited significant volatility in 2025, reflecting both its growth potential and market challenges. According to posts on X, NVDA experienced a 44% decline from a high of $153 to $86 over four months earlier in the year, yet analysts remain optimistic about its recovery. As of June 16, 2025, the stock is trading around $124, approaching a key resistance level, with some analysts projecting a potential rise to $170 or higher by year-end, driven by strong fundamentals and AI demand. NVIDIA‚Äôs revenue grew by 70% year-over-year, with free cash flow increasing by 125%, despite trading at its lowest price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio in six years, suggesting undervaluation. The stock‚Äôs average price target, based on 65 analysts, is $170, representing a 41% potential gain from its current price. Notably, 91% of analysts recommend a ‚ÄúBuy,‚Äù 9% suggest ‚ÄúHold,‚Äù and none advocate ‚ÄúSell‚Äù.
NVDA‚Äôs top holdings within major ETFs, such as the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY), account for approximately 6% of the fund‚Äôs weight, underscoring its influence in the broader market. Its beta of 1.7 indicates higher volatility compared to the S&P 500, appealing to traders seeking growth but requiring careful risk management.
Key Market-Moving News for NVDA as of June 16, 2025
Recent news highlights NVDA‚Äôs critical role in the AI and semiconductor sectors, with several developments shaping its market trajectory. On February 26, 2025, Bank of America reiterated a ‚ÄúBuy‚Äù rating with a $190 price target ahead of NVDA‚Äôs fiscal Q4 2025 earnings call, expecting a modest beat in sales guidance despite challenges from the Blackwell product transition and China restrictions. Evercore ISI also maintained an ‚ÄúOutperform‚Äù rating with a $190 target, noting NVDA‚Äôs 12% recovery from its February 3 low, though it lagged the S&P 500 by 7% due to concerns over AI demand shifts toward competitors like DeepSeek and ASICs.
Additionally, posts on X indicate strong retail sentiment, with NVDA clearing a key resistance at $115 and approaching $124, fueled by anticipation for its May 28, 2025, earnings report. Analysts expect robust earnings driven by AI and gaming sector growth, with some predicting a run-up toward $170 by year-end. These developments highlight NVDA‚Äôs resilience and its position as a leading AI innovator, though traders must remain vigilant of macroeconomic factors and competitive pressures.
Comparison with a Highly Correlated Stock: TSM
NVDA shares a high correlation with Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSM), a global leader in chip production, with a correlation coefficient of approximately 0.80 over the past year. Both companies are integral to the semiconductor and AI ecosystems, with NVDA designing cutting-edge GPUs and TSM manufacturing them. In 2025, TSM has shown similar volatility, with Tickeron‚Äôs AI analysis noting its pairing with the Direxion Daily Semiconductor Bear 3X Shares (SOXS) in trading strategies, yielding up to 104% annualized returns through Tickeron‚Äôs Double Agent Trading Bots. While NVDA‚Äôs P/E ratio stands at 28, TSM‚Äôs is slightly higher at 30, reflecting strong investor confidence in its manufacturing dominance. However, NVDA‚Äôs broader exposure to AI software and gaming gives it a slight edge in growth potential, though TSM‚Äôs critical role in chip supply chains ensures its stability.
Trading NVDA with Inverse ETFs
For traders seeking to hedge NVDA‚Äôs volatility or capitalize on potential declines, inverse ETFs like the AXS 1.25X NVDA Bear Daily ETF (NVDS) offer a strategic tool. The RTX series, known for its real-time ray tracing, is particularly suited for creating lifelike VR environments.
What could we expect as an investor ?
The potential market for metaverse and VR technologies is huge. Some analysts predict the metaverse could be an $800 billion market by 2024 and could grow to $30 trillion by 2030. NVIDIA‚Äôs strong presence in this space could play a significant role in its future growth.
That said, the metaverse and VR industries are still in their early stages, and how they develop remains uncertain. Factors like user adoption, content creation, and technological hurdles could affect growth. NVIDIA also faces competition from other tech giants that are heavily investing in these areas.
Despite these challenges, NVIDIA‚Äôs technological leadership and strategic position in the metaverse and VR could provide significant growth in the long run. As these markets evolve, NVIDIA‚Äôs contributions to building metaverse infrastructure and enhancing VR capabilities may become key drivers of its stock performance.
For investors like us looking at NVIDIA‚Äôs long-term potential, it‚Äôs essential to keep an eye on developments in the metaverse and VR. While these sectors are filled with opportunity, their ever-changing nature also brings a degree of uncertainty. NVIDIA‚Äôs ability to seize these opportunities could shape its future market standing and stock value.
Conclusion
Let‚Äôs conclude now what we have discussed in this article ‚ÄúNvidia Stock Price Forecast for 2025, 2030, 2040, 2050‚Äù so far. We are not expecting Nvidia to rise much in 2025. As we have discussed in its historical analysis, this stock experienced a multi-bagger growth in its last 5 year term. So, in 2025, it may rise to ~ $170 which looks quite normal for a company with this kind of potential. But after 2025, when metaverse will get more light and people‚Äôs attention, it may again turn to a multi-bagger for you as we speak of 2035, 2040, 2050 and beyond.

How MarketBeat Calculates Price Target and Consensus Rating
MarketBeat calculates consensus analyst ratings for stocks using the most recent rating from each Wall Street analyst that has rated a stock within the last twelve months. Each analyst's rating is normalized to a standardized rating score of 1 (sell), 2 (hold), 3 (buy) or 4 (strong buy). Analyst consensus ratings scores are calculated using the mean average of the number of normalized sell, hold, buy and strong buy ratings from Wall Street analysts. Each stock's consensus analyst rating is derived from its calculated consensus ratings score (0 to .5 = Strong Sell, .5 to 1 = Sell, 1 to 1.5 = Reduce, 1.5 to 2.5 = Hold, 2.5 to 3.0 = Moderate Buy, 3.0 to 3.5 = Buy, >3.5 = Strong Buy). MarketBeat's consensus price targets are a mean average of the most recent available price targets set by each analyst that has set a price target for the stock in the last twelve months. MarketBeat's consensus ratings and consensus price targets may differ from those calculated by other firms due to differences in methodology and available data.

Should I Buy NVIDIA Stock? NVDA Pros and Cons Explained
These pros and cons were generated based on recent news and financial data from MarketBeat in order to provide readers with the fastest and most accurate insights. They were last updated on Monday, June 23, 2025. Please send any questions or comments about these NVIDIA pros and cons to contact@marketbeat.com.
NVIDIA
Bull Case

Here are some ways that investors could benefit from investing in NVidia:

NVidia has received multiple upgrades from analysts, with price targets reaching as high as $210, indicating strong market confidence in its growth potential.
The current stock price is around $144, which may present a buying opportunity for investors looking to enter at a lower price point before potential gains.
Institutional investors own over 65% of NVidia's stock, suggesting strong institutional confidence and stability in the company's performance.
Nvidia's recent product innovations in graphics and compute solutions position it well in the growing AI and gaming markets, which are expected to drive future revenue growth.
The company has a solid financial foundation, with a low debt-to-equity ratio, indicating a strong balance sheet and reduced financial risk for investors.

NVIDIA
Bear Case

Investors should be bearish about investing in NVidia for these reasons:

Insider selling has been significant, with over 2.4 million shares sold recently, which may indicate a lack of confidence from those closest to the company.
Despite positive analyst ratings, one analyst has issued a sell rating, highlighting potential concerns about the stock's valuation or future performance.
The stock has experienced volatility, with a 1-year low of $86.62, which may deter risk-averse investors.
Market competition in the graphics and AI sectors is intensifying, which could impact NVidia's market share and profitability in the future.
While institutional ownership is high, it also means that any significant sell-off by these investors could lead to increased volatility in the stock price.

NVDA Forecast - Frequently Asked Questions
What is NVIDIA's forecast for 2025?
According to the research reports of 42 Wall Street equities research analysts, the average twelve-month stock price forecast for NVIDIA is $173.69, with a high forecast of $220.00 and a low forecast of $120.00.
Should I buy or sell NVIDIA stock right now?
42 Wall Street analysts have issued "buy," "hold," and "sell" ratings for NVIDIA in the last twelve months. There is currently 1 sell rating, 4 hold ratings, 34 buy ratings and 3 strong buy ratings for the stock. The consensus among Wall Street analysts is that investors should "moderate buy" NVDA shares.
Does NVIDIA's stock price have much upside?
According to analysts, NVIDIA's stock has a predicted upside of 17.77% based on their 12-month stock forecasts.
Has NVIDIA been upgraded or downgraded by Wall Street analysts recently?
Over the previous 90 days, NVIDIA's stock had 3 upgrades and 3 downgrades by analysts.
What analysts cover NVIDIA?
NVIDIA has been rated by research analysts at Arete Research, Bank of America, Barclays, Benchmark, Cantor Fitzgerald, Citigroup, DA Davidson, Hsbc Global Res, HSBC, Mizuho, Morgan Stanley, Needham & Company LLC, Oppenheimer, Piper Sandler, Raymond James Financial, Rosenblatt Securities, Seaport Res Ptn, Summit Insights, TD Cowen, Truist Financial, UBS Group, and Wedbush in the past 90 days.
Do Wall Street analysts like NVIDIA more than its competitors?
Analysts like NVIDIA more than other "computer and technology" companies. The consensus rating score for NVIDIA is 2.93 while the average consensus rating score for "computer and technology" companies is 2.65. Learn more on how NVDA compares to other companies.

How MarketBeat Calculates Price Target and Consensus Rating
MarketBeat calculates consensus analyst ratings for stocks using the most recent rating from each Wall Street analyst that has rated a stock within the last twelve months. Each analyst's rating is normalized to a standardized rating score of 1 (sell), 2 (hold), 3 (buy) or 4 (strong buy). Analyst consensus ratings scores are calculated using the mean average of the number of normalized sell, hold, buy and strong buy ratings from Wall Street analysts. Each stock's consensus analyst rating is derived from its calculated consensus ratings score (0 to .5 = Strong Sell, .5 to 1 = Sell, 1 to 1.5 = Reduce, 1.5 to 2.5 = Hold, 2.5 to 3.0 = Moderate Buy, 3.0 to 3.5 = Buy, >3.5 = Strong Buy). MarketBeat's consensus price targets are a mean average of the most recent available price targets set by each analyst that has set a price target for the stock in the last twelve months. MarketBeat's consensus ratings and consensus price targets may differ from those calculated by other firms due to differences in methodology and available data.

Should I Buy NVIDIA Stock? NVDA Pros and Cons Explained
These pros and cons were generated based on recent news and financial data from MarketBeat in order to provide readers with the fastest and most accurate insights. They were last updated on Monday, June 23, 2025. Please send any questions or comments about these NVIDIA pros and cons to contact@marketbeat.com.
NVIDIA
Bull Case

Here are some ways that investors could benefit from investing in NVidia:

NVidia has received multiple upgrades from analysts, with price targets reaching as high as $210, indicating strong market confidence in its growth potential.
The current stock price is around $144, which may present a buying opportunity for investors looking to enter at a lower price point before potential gains.
Institutional investors own over 65% of NVidia's stock, suggesting strong institutional confidence and stability in the company's performance.
Nvidia's recent product innovations in graphics and compute solutions position it well in the growing AI and gaming markets, which are expected to drive future revenue growth.
The company has a solid financial foundation, with a low debt-to-equity ratio, indicating a strong balance sheet and reduced financial risk for investors.

NVIDIA
Bear Case

Investors should be bearish about investing in NVidia for these reasons:

Insider selling has been significant, with over 2.4 million shares sold recently, which may indicate a lack of confidence from those closest to the company.
Despite positive analyst ratings, one analyst has issued a sell rating, highlighting potential concerns about the stock's valuation or future performance.
The stock has experienced volatility, with a 1-year low of $86.62, which may deter risk-averse investors.
Market competition in the graphics and AI sectors is intensifying, which could impact NVidia's market share and profitability in the future.
While institutional ownership is high, it also means that any significant sell-off by these investors could lead to increased volatility in the stock price.

Stock Forecast FAQ
What is the NVIDIA stock forecast?

How to read and forecast NVIDIA stock price movements?
NVIDIA stock traders use a variety of tools to make a prediction on which way the NVDA market is likely to head next. These tools can roughly be divided into indicators and chart patterns. When trying to make a NVIDIA stock forecast, traders also try to identify important support and resistance levels, which can give an indication of when a downtrend is likely to slow down and when an uptrend is likely to stall.
NVIDIA Stock Forecast Indicators
Moving averages are among the most popular NVIDIA stock prediction tools. As the name suggests, a moving average provides the average closing price for NVDA stock over a selected time frame, which is divided into a number of periods of the same length. For example, a 12-day simple moving average for NVDA is a sum of NVDA‚Äôs closing prices over the last 12 days which is then divided by 12.
In addition to the simple moving average (SMA), traders also use another type of moving average called the exponential moving average (EMA). The EMA gives more weight to more recent prices, and therefore reacts more quickly to recent price action.
50-day, 100-day and 200-day moving averages are among the most commonly used indicators in the stock market to identify important resistance and support levels. If the NVIDIA stock price moves above any of these averages, it is generally seen as a bullish sign for NVIDIA stock. Conversely, a drop below an important moving average is usually interpreted as a negative forecast for the NVDA market.
Traders also like to use the RSI and Fibonacci retracement level indicators to try and ascertain the future direction of the NVIDIA stock price.
How to read NVIDIA stock charts and forecast price movements?
When making a NVIDIA stock forecast, most traders use candlestick charts, as they provide more information than a simple line chart. Traders can view candlesticks that represent the price action of NVIDIA stock with different granularity ‚Äì for example, you could choose a 5-minute candlestick chart for extremely short-term price action or choose a weekly candlestick chart to identify long-terms trends. 1-hour, 4-hour and 1-day candlestick charts are among the most popular.
Let‚Äôs use a 1-hour candlestick chart as an example of how this type of price chart gives us information about opening and closing prices. The chart is divided into ‚Äúcandles‚Äù that give us information about NVIDIA‚Äôs stock price action in 1-hour chunks. Each candlestick will display NVDA‚Äôs opening price, closing price, as well as the highest and lowest prices that NVIDIA reached within the 1-hour period. This information makes it easier to make an informed price prediction.
t‚Äôs also important to pay attention to the color of the candle ‚Äì a green candle means that the closing price was higher than the opening price, while a red candle tells us the opposite. Some charts will use hollow and filled candlestick bodies instead of colors to represent the same thing.
What affects the price of NVDA stock?
Just like with any other asset, the price action of NVIDIA stock is driven by supply and demand. These dynamics can be influenced by fundamental factors, such as earnings announcements, new product launches, acquisitions and mergers, and other factors. The NVDA stock price can also be influenced by market sentiment, broader economic conditions, interest rates, inflation rates and political developments.
Bullish and bearish price prediction patterns
Some traders try to identify candlestick patterns when making stock price predictions to try and get an edge over the competition. Some candlestick formations are seen as likely to forecast bullish price action, while others are seen as bearish.

üí∞ Nvidia Stock Price Forecast 2025, 2030, 2040 & 2050
ByFVJ Equity ExpertsUpdated on May 13, 2025
23 Comments
/Stock Market/
4.8/5 by 38 Readers
üëâ 30 Seconds Summary üëà
Nvidia Corporation (Nasdaq : NVDA) remains a top player in the tech industry with strong long-term growth potential. Our projections suggest NVDA‚Äôs stock could reach $169.34 in 2025, $846.14 by 2030, and $2,503.14 by 2035. Looking further ahead, it may rise to $4,072.35 by 2040 and $7,500.46 by 2050. These forecasts highlight Nvidia‚Äôs dominance and potential for substantial returns in the years to come.
In this digital age, Nvidia (NVDA) is one of the major player in the tech industry, known for leading the way in several areas. The company designs cutting-edge graphics processing units (GPUs), gaming software, and professional visualization tools. You can find Nvidia‚Äôs stock listed on NASDAQ. This article aims to provide investors with valuable insights and a detailed outlook on Nvidia stock price forecast 2025, 2030, 2040, and 2050.

Nvidia‚Äôs GPUs have long been known for delivering top-tier performance in gaming, giving players stunning visuals and an immersive experience. This early success paved the way for Nvidia to branch out into areas like artificial intelligence, data centers, and autonomous vehicles. It also develops system-on-chip units for mobile devices and the automotive market, with a strong focus on advancements in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, network solutions, and cloud computing. Nvidia plays a crucial role as a key supplier of media and communication processors that power AI technologies.
57
What's your take on Tech / IT Industry for next One Year?

BULLISH

BEARISH
Now, Nvidia is a major force in the tech world, with a market cap that highlights its influence and growth potential. In this ‚ÄòNvidia Stock Price Forecast‚Äò article, we‚Äôll take a look at how Nvidia‚Äôs stock price could evolve in the months, years, and even decades ahead.
About Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) | Company Information
Company NameNvidia Corporation
Stock ExchangeNasdaq
Ticker SymbolNVDA
SectorTechnology
HeadquarterSanta Clara, California
Founded inApril 1993
FounderJensen Haung, Chris Malachowsky, Curtis Priem
Market Cap.(June 2024)$3.35 trillion
Revenue (2024)$60.93 billion
Total assets (2024)$65.74 billion
Peer CompaniesBroadcom Inc. (AVGO), Qualcomm Inc. (QCOM), Arm Holdings PLC (ARM), Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Ltd. (TSM), Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD)
Nvidia Corporation was established in April 1993. In just 30 years, it has now became a 3.34 trillion USD company. That‚Äôs really a whooping growth for a company. Focusing on graphics and gaming equipment sector, Nvidia generated a revenue of $60.93 Billion USD in 2024. As gaming is not only for kids anymore, many adults look towards gaming as a career option, we are expecting more growth for the company. Nvidia also started working towards Virtual Reality and metaverse.
Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Analysis | Past, Present & Future
We‚Äôll look at both charts and key financial data to help you understand what could impact NVDA‚Äôs stock price in the short and long term. If you‚Äôre wondering about Nvidia‚Äôs growth potential, keep reading to see where this stock might be headed.
Nvidia Stock Price Historical Data [2001-2024]

From the above table, it is clear that NVDA‚Äôs share is trading near it‚Äôs All-Time High of $148 per share. While doing NVDA share price prediction, we took only last 5 year data into account because in IT sector, most drastic changes were experienced only in last 5 years.
So, in the period of 2020-2024, NVDA‚Äôs share dropped at the low of $3.17. For a company, which traded at just $3.17 in last 5 year and now its trading on 148.88 (as on 08.11.2024), it looks like a massive success.
Analysis with live chart for Nvidia stock forecast for 1 year from now
As we can clearly see that Nvidia share price has shown a tremendous growth over the last year. In January 2024, it was trading near to $40but along with its uptrend and after experiencing some corrections, now it is trading at $114.06 as onMarch 03, 2025 which is three times the value before 2024.
Here as per its yearly growth of almost 300%, we are now expecting a steady growth in Nvidia stock price.
Time-Frame analysis of Nvidia : Hourly, Daily & Weekly
By analyzing a Nvidia stock price through a timeframe chart, we can gather some key insights that will assist us in determining the final NVDA stock predictions : ‚Äì
| Time Frame | Observation |
| --- | --- |
|  View Hourly Chart (Every candle represents Nasdaq : NVDAshare‚Äôs trading session of one hour. Each single candle represent the HIGH, LOW, OPEN, CLOSE of that particular hour) | On hourly time-frame, we can observe that NVDA stock is trading below the 21 hour,50 hour, 100 hour and200 hour SMA. This indicates that the Nvidia stock is in Sideways to Downtrend for short term. |
|  View Daily Chart (Every candle represents Nasdaq : NVDAshare‚Äôs trading session of one day. Each single candle represent the HIGH, LOW, OPEN, CLOSE of that particular day) | On daily time-frame, we can observe that NVDA stock is trading BELOW 21 Day SMA, 50 Day, 100 Day& 200 DaySMA. This is the sign of Bearishnessin medium term. |
|  View Weekly Chart (Every candle represents Nasdaq : NVDA stock‚Äôs trading session of one week. Each single candle represent the HIGH, LOW, OPEN, CLOSE of that particular week) | On the weekly time-frame NVDA stock is trading below 21 weeks but Above 50 weeks, 100 weeks & 200 weeks SMA.This indicates that NVDA stock has a clear BULLISHsentiment, if we look at it from a long term perspective. |
|  View Monthly Chart (Every candle represents Nasdaq : NVDA stock‚Äôs trading session of one Monthly. Each single candle represent the HIGH, LOW, OPEN, CLOSE of that particular week) | On the Monthly time-frame NVDA stock is trading Above all 21 Months, 50 Months, 100 Months & 200 Months SMA.This indicates that NVDA stock has a clear BULLISHsentiment, if we look at it from a very long term perspective. |
Since there is a BULLISH perspective shown by SMAs in Weekly time-frame while a SIDEWAYS to NEGATIVEperspective in Hourly & Daily time-frames. This can be a confusing scenario for a trader. By observing the directions of the SMAs, we can find that NVDA‚Äôs direction is always POSITIVE in Weekly time-frame while NEGATIVE in Hourly & Daily Timeframe.
Dow Jones, NASDAQ & Nvidia : A comparative Analysis
Check out the comparative year on year returns of Dow Jones, Nasdaq and NVDA. Here, we are showing the returns by comparing them on closing basis ‚Äì

Virtual Reality & Metaverse ‚Äì Nvidia
NVIDIA stretched his realm beyond just computing and AI, with the company set to play a major role in the future of the metaverse and virtual reality (VR). These rapidly growing areas offer big opportunities for NVIDIA and could influence its stock performance and overall market value over the long term.
Nvidia‚Äôs Metaverse
At the heart of NVIDIA‚Äôs metaverse strategy is the Omniverse platform, a real-time 3D design and simulation tool. This platform leverages NVIDIA‚Äôs strength in graphics processing and AI to build immersive virtual worlds. The Omniverse is being used in various fields, from architecture and engineering to entertainment, making NVIDIA a key player in developing the infrastructure for the metaverse.
Nvidia‚Äôs Virtual Reality
In the VR space, NVIDIA‚Äôs GPUs are critical for creating high-quality virtual experiences. As VR technology continues to improve, the need for more powerful graphics processors will likely increase, boosting sales of NVIDIA‚Äôs high-end GPUs. The RTX series, known for its real-time ray tracing, is particularly suited for creating lifelike VR environments.
What could we expect as an investor ?
The potential market for metaverse and VR technologies is huge. Some analysts predict the metaverse could be an $800 billion market by 2024 and could grow to $30 trillion by 2030. NVIDIA‚Äôs strong presence in this space could play a significant role in its future growth.
That said, the metaverse and VR industries are still in their early stages, and how they develop remains uncertain. Factors like user adoption, content creation, and technological hurdles could affect growth. NVIDIA also faces competition from other tech giants that are heavily investing in these areas.
Despite these challenges, NVIDIA‚Äôs technological leadership and strategic position in the metaverse and VR could provide significant growth in the long run. As these markets evolve, NVIDIA‚Äôs contributions to building metaverse infrastructure and enhancing VR capabilities may become key drivers of its stock performance.
For investors like us looking at NVIDIA‚Äôs long-term potential, it‚Äôs essential to keep an eye on developments in the metaverse and VR. While these sectors are filled with opportunity, their ever-changing nature also brings a degree of uncertainty. NVIDIA‚Äôs ability to seize these opportunities could shape its future market standing and stock value.
